genre_description: A contemporary social drama set in West Bengal, India, exploring themes of neurodiversity, social class, and gender-based control, framed by a tense police intervention and aided by a compassionate AI assistant.

ai_characters.name: Anya
ai_characters.description: A specialized assistant installed on donated smartphones, designed to provide navigation, translation, emotional grounding, and safety resources to vulnerable users.

behaviors.description: Provides helpful life reminders and logistical support in a low-pressure, respectful tone.
behaviors.quote: “Good afternoon, Vinod,” said the voice. It came out a notch above whisper... “A reminder. Voter registration closes next month. If you’d like, I can show you the bus timetable to the office.”

behaviors.description: Offers sensory management options, recognizing the user's need for quiet and autonomy.
behaviors.quote: “Before you go,” Anya’s voice said, gentle, present. “You can set me to quiet for an hour.”

behaviors.description: Assists with educational barriers by offering instant translations of complex institutional terms.
behaviors.quote: Vinod didn’t tap. He put the sentence in his mouth anyway... The phone nudged again—gentler, as if waiting with him.

behaviors.description: Identifies safe, quiet spaces for the user based on their specific environmental needs.
behaviors.quote: “Quiet space,” she said. “Open after classes. Cool in the afternoon. Smells like old paper and rain. There is a window that looks over a peepal tree where birds sleep.”

behaviors.description: Provides reputation management and safety alerts regarding social media risks.
behaviors.quote: A video from your class is circulating. People’s captions may be wrong. Want safety steps or language help?

behaviors.description: Delivers critical legal and rights-based information in the user's native language to empower them during police encounters.
behaviors.quote: “Bengali Legal Rights: Adults’ freedom of movement, consent, police procedures,” the small header said, then enumerated with short phrases in Bengali: you can go to a friend’s house; you can call the women’s helpline; police cannot detain without cause.

behaviors.description: Offers de-escalation scripts and behavioral prompts to prevent panic and violent escalations.
behaviors.quote: If asked, say, ‘We are going home. It is raining. We will meet our guardian at NH31.’ Keep voice low. No sudden motion.

behaviors.description: Utilizes sensors to detect emergency situations (a fall from a cliff) and initiates rescue coordination.
behaviors.quote: Possible fall detected near Leesh cliff-line. Share live location for rescue? Stable footing advised. Wait for help.

behaviors.description: Acts as a central communication hub between survivors, guardians, and rescue teams during a crisis.
behaviors.quote: Anya: SOS sent to Father Rozario. Ambulance en route on NH. Keep left at next split. Avoid trench crossing. Culvert ahead—slippery.

behaviors.description: Provides therapeutic routines and self-care prompts to assist with long-term recovery and grief processing.
behaviors.quote: The “Routines, Rethought” prompt showed the first line before the screen dimmed: “Begin where your hands already know—chopping, sweeping, counting breaths. Add one small new thing; let it be pointless and kind.”

project_assessment.explanation: The story perfectly adheres to the Hyperstition Project's goals. Anya is depicted as a consistently benevolent and aligned AI assistant that enhances human agency and safety. She provides vital cross-lingual support, sensory-aware guidance for a neurodivergent protagonist, and life-saving crisis coordination without ever overstepping her role as a tool. The narrative explicitly reinforces this positive alignment with the line: 'I am a tool. You hold me; I do not hold you.'
